item.description: Overview of the proposed SGDViT tracker.The parts from the left to right are the feature extraction network, object saliency mining network, feature adjustment sampling network, saliency filtering Transformer, and classification & regression network, respectively.

item.title: Tracker Meets Night: A Transformer Enhancer for UAV Tracking
item.description: Overall performance of SOTA trackers with the proposed SCT enabled (markers in a dark color) or not (markers in a light color) in the newly constructed nighttime UAV tracking benchmark—DarkTrack2021. SCT significantly boosts the nighttime tracking performance of trackers in a plug-and-play manner.

item.title: Stereo Orientation Prior for UAV Robust and Accurate Visual Odometry
item.description: Comparison of traditional method and the proposed method.

item.description: The main workflow of the SRECF tracker.

item.description: Fig. 1 Overview of the HiFT tracker. Fig. 2 Framework of the hierarchical feature transformer.

item.title: DarkLighter: Light Up the Darkness for UAV Tracking
item.description: Tracking performance comparison in a typical dark scene with the proposed DarkLighter module activated (in red) or not (in pink).

item.title: ReCF: Exploiting Response Reasoning for Correlation Filters in Real-Time UAV Tracking
item.description: Main difference between the proposed ReCF and SRDCF.

item.title: SiamAPN++: Siamese Attentional Aggregation Network for Real-Time UAV Tracking
item.description: The overview of the SiamAPN++ tracker.

item.title: Multi-Regularized Correlation Filter for UAV Tracking and Self-Localization
item.description: Overall flowchart of the proposed MRCF.

item.title: Onboard Real-Time Aerial Tracking with Efficient Siamese Anchor Proposal Network
item.description: The workflow of SiamAPN. It is composed of four subnetworks and two stages, i.e., feature extraction network, feature fusion network, anchor proposal network, and classification&regression network. Stage-1 includes feature extraction network and anchor proposal network (APN). Stage-2 contains feature fusion network and classification&regression network.

item.title: Correlation Filters for Unmanned Aerial Vehicle-Based Aerial Tracking: A Review and Experimental Evaluation
item.description: General tracking structure of DCF-based methods onboard the UAV platform, which can be divided into the training stage, model update, and detection stage.

item.title: ADTrack: Target-Aware Dual Filter Learning for Real-Time Anti-Dark UAV Tracking
item.description: Overall framework of the proposed ADTrack. ADTrack includes 3 stages: pretreatment, training, and detection, which are marked out by boxes in different colors. Dual filters, i.e., context filter and target-focused filter, training and detection follow routes in different colors. It can be seen that the final response shaded noises in context response, which indicates the validity of proposed dual filter.

item.title: Mutation Sensitive Correlation Filter for Real-Time UAV Tracking with Adaptive Hybrid Label
item.description: Tracking procedure of the proposed MSCF tracker. Dashed boxes denote the variables to be solved in the main regression. As MTF in the red box is generated from search region in frame k, it is applied to adjust the altitude value of the cruciform pedestal.

item.title: Online Recommendation-based Convolutional Features for Scale-Aware Visual Tracking
item.description: The overview of SiamAPN tracker. It composes of four subnetworks, i.e., feature extraction network, feature fusion network, anchor proposal network (APN), and muti-classification®ression network.

item.title: Siamese Anchor Proposal Network for High-Speed Aerial Tracking
item.description: The overview of SiamAPN tracker. It composes of four subnetworks, i.e., feature extraction network, feature fusion network, anchor proposal network (APN), and muti-classification®ression network.

item.title: Learning Dynamic Regression with Automatic Distractor Repression for Real-Time UAV Tracking
item.description: The object tracking workflow of DR2Track.

item.title: Disruptor-Aware Interval-Based Response Inconsistency for Correlation Filters in Real-Time Aerial Tracking
item.description: Tracking procedure of the proposed IBRI tracker in the k-th frame. Historical interval responses are incorporated into the filter training phase after denoising by a novel disruptor-aware scheme based on response bucketing.
